com.simbachain.auth

Class AccessTokenProvider<C extends AuthConfig>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simbachain.auth.AccessTokenProvider<C>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlocksTokenProvider, KcTokenProvider, LocalTokenProvider, PlatTokenProvider

    public abstract class AccessTokenProvider<C extends AuthConfig>
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an AccessToken. AuthConfig implementations provide access to an instance of this interface in order for clients to be able to grab a token.

        public abstract AccessToken getToken()
                              throws SimbaException
        Get the token
        Returns:
        an AccessToken

      • getConfig

        protected C getConfig()

      • isTokenExpired

        public boolean isTokenExpired(AccessToken token)
        Checks to see if a token has expired, by checking the 'expires' key Adds an offset to allow for delays when performing auth processes
        Parameters:
        token - the token to check for expiry. Should contain an 'expires' key
        Returns:
        true if the token is expired

      • cacheToken

        public void cacheToken(java.lang.String clientId,
                       AccessToken token)
        Saves the token data to a file or memory. Checks the tokenDir for alternative token storage locations, otherwise uses the current working path Creates the token directory if it doesn't already exist. Adds an "expires" key to the auth token data, set to time "now" added to the expires_in time This is used later to discover if the token has expired
        Parameters:
        clientId - The ID for the client, token files are named clientId_token.json
        token - The token object to save

      • getCachedToken

        public AccessToken getCachedToken(java.lang.String clientId)
        Checks a local directory for a file containing an auth token If present, check the token hasn't expired, otherwise return it Checks the tokenDir config value for alternative token storage locations, otherwise uses the current working path
        Parameters:
        clientId - The ID for the client, token files are named clientId_token.json
        Returns:
        an AccessToken, retrieved from the token file or memory.
